articles.description: The House of Representatives' investigation into Russia's election interference may have ended, but Democrats are still discussing what they'd like to do if and when they regain a House majority -- and it could have significant repercussions for the tech indu…
articles.title: Democrats aim to subpoena Apple, Twitter over private chats

articles.description: New reports indicate that Cambridge Analytica, the data team affiliated with Trump's 2016 presidential campaign, harvested data from 50 million Facebook users—and Facebook failed to stop them.
articles.title: Trump Campaign Data Consultants Cambridge Analytica Took 50 Million Facebook Users' Data
articles.author: Issie Lapowsky

articles.description: Facebook said on Thursday it had suspended a data analytics firm associated with the Trump campaign, but may have indeed greatly downplayed the scale of the data that firm actually had access to, according to a new report in The New York Times. Cambridge Anal…
articles.title: Trump campaign-linked data firm Cambridge Analytica reportedly collected info on 50M Facebook profiles
articles.author: Matthew Lynley

articles.description: Facebook announced late Friday that it had suspended the account of Strategic Communication Laboratories, and its political data analytics firm Cambridge Analytica — which used Facebook data to target voters for President Donald Trump’s campaign in the 2016 e…
articles.title: Facebook suspends Cambridge Analytica, the data analysis firm that worked for the Trump campaign
articles.author: Jonathan Shieber

articles.description: Ido Kilovaty Contributor Ido Kilovaty is a Cyber Fellow at the Center for Global Legal Challenges and Resident Fellow at the Information Society Project, Yale Law School. More posts by this contributor If it talks like a government and acts like a government,…
articles.title: The Cambridge Analytica Debacle is not a Facebook “Data Breach.” Maybe It Should Be.
articles.author: Jonathan Shieber

articles.description: Facebook has booted Cambridge Analytica, a data firm once hired by President Donald Trump’s 2016 campaign, and its UK-based parent company SCL Group after it allegedly received user data improperly downloaded and shared by a University of Cambridge professor.…
articles.title: Facebook Suspends Cambridge Analytica, Data Firm That Worked on Donald Trump's Campaign

articles.description: President Trump with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada in the Oval Office last year. Mr. Trump said this past week that he had made up information during a conversation with Mr. Trudeau.
articles.title: White House Memo: Trump and the Truth: A President Tests His Own Credibility
articles.author: PETER BAKER

articles.description: The West Wing of the White House on Friday. A Brookings Institution study found a 46 percent turnover rate in the Trump administration for the most important jobs.
articles.title: No Heads Rolled at the White House Friday (So Far). But Anxiety Abounds.
articles.author: MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MAGGIE HABERMAN

articles.description: Lack of candor is a fireable offense at the F.B.I., but Mr. McCabe’s last-minute dismissal from the agency was carried out against a highly politicized backdrop.
articles.title: Andrew McCabe, a Target of Trump’s F.B.I. Scorn, Is Fired Over Candor Questions
articles.author: MATT APUZZO and ADAM GOLDMAN

articles.description: President Trump’s lawyers claimed in court on Friday that Stephanie Clifford violated a confidentially agreement at least 20 times, exposing her to damages of at least $20 million. She has said she had an affair with him.
articles.title: Trump’s Lawyers Claim Stormy Daniels Violated Confidentiality Agreement at Least 20 Times
articles.author: JIM RUTENBERG and MAGGIE HABERMAN

articles.description: Easter Island is eroding. Joan Baez on her next chapter. Should some species be allowed to die out? And more.
articles.title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads

articles.description: It's March Madness time for TV fans. Of course I don't mean basketball; I mean the nail-biting agony of waiting for networks to renew your favorite shows. This is the fourth year in a row of that special hell for Jane the Virgin viewers, and the third for a d…
articles.title: If the CW doesn't renew 'Crazy Ex-Girlfriend' and 'Jane the Virgin' we lose all hope in the world

articles.description: The memos could corroborate the testimony of James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director who said President Trump had pressured him to shut down an investigation.
articles.title: Andrew McCabe, Fired F.B.I. Deputy, Is Said to Have Kept Memos on Trump

articles.description: The lawyer, John Dowd, said he was speaking on behalf of President Trump, only to backtrack shortly afterward and say he was speaking only for himself.
articles.title: Trump Lawyer Says Special Counsel Inquiry Should Be Ended
articles.author: MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MAGGIE HABERMAN

articles.description: Scott Pruitt, the administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, has a record of rolling back regulations, which some see as a possible springboard to higher office.

articles.title: Melania stays mum amid Stormy Daniels news

articles.description: Former CIA Director John Brennan slammed President Trump's reaction to the firing of Andrew McCabe, saying in a tweet "America will triumph over you."
